page.title: 06EVENTS IN THE GRIN'TON AREA
page.content: 1985 could be termed a year of celebra- tion.Grindleton School planted a tree to mark its reprieve from closure, Chatburn youngsters successfully cam- paigned for youth club premises,and a sponsored spell at Waddington and West- Bradford School raised 720 pounds for computer and video equipment.Grindleton held its first parish election for 18 yrs and Chatburn entered the Lancashire Best-Kept Village competition;one parish councillor volunteering to sweep the village streets. West Bradford and Grindleton residents attended meetings to assess the chances of supplying gas to the villages.In addition to the usual crop of sports days,jumble sales and coffee evenings everywhere,traditions were upheld at West Bradford with its senior citizen's outing,barn dance,church fairs,cheese\ wine,and recipe-tasting evenings.
